definitions: To bring down (one's foot) heavily on the ground or on something else.
To impress a pattern or mark on (a surface, object, etc.) with an engraved or inked block or die.
To affix a postage stamp to (a letter or parcel).
To characterize or mark as if with a stamp.
examples: She will stamp her foot in frustration.
The machine can stamp out thousands of parts per hour.
Remember to stamp the envelope before mailing it.
His work will stamp him as a true innovator.
